txt.en: 'Oh, hello, my dear. I wonder if you might help me with a small task. I am worried that some of the fish being sent up to the king's hall is not as fresh as the royal table deserves. The crates of fish need to be examined, but if the fishermen see me coming, they're quick to swap out the crates they intended with fresh fish, only to later send up fish of poor quality.\n\n'Tour the docks and inspect the crates and report back to me. Together we can identify who has been passing along subpar catches.'
You should let Anírwen know that you examined many crates of fish.\n\nAnírwen is at her shop in Dol Amroth.
Anírwen is concerned about the quality of the fish that is being sent up to the king's hall.

'Welcome back, dear! Tell me, how were the crates? Did you find fish unworthy of the prince's table?'

You inform her of your findings. 

'Is that so? I knew it. I shall reprimand those swindlers immediately!'
Anírwen has asked you to inspect crates of fish on the docks of the bay.\n\nThe docks are in the Dol Amroth bay.
